text: Lubomir (Lubosh) Kavalek (, August 9, 1943 – January 18, 2021)Sunnucks 1970, p. 253. was a Czech-American chess player. He was awarded both the International Master and Grandmaster titles by FIDE in 1965.Hooper & Whyld 1992, p. 195. He won two Czechoslovak and three U.S. championships, and was ranked as the world's #10 player in 1974. Kavalek was also a chess coach, organizer, teacher, commentator, author and award-winning columnist. He was born in Prague, Czechoslovakia. Kavalek died on January 18, 2021 in Renton, Washington at the age of 77.Smutná zpráva. V 77 letech zemřel legendární šachista Kaválek ==References== Category:1943 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Czechoslovak sportspeople Category:American chess players Category:Chess grandmasters
title: Lubomir Kavalek
